MassSpecData R6 class and methods

Source: R/class_R6_MassSpecData.R
MassSpecData.Rd

The MassSpecData R6 class is a framework with methods for parsing, processing, visualizing and storing mass spectrometry (MS) data.

References

Helmus R, ter Laak TL, van Wezel AP, de Voogt P, Schymanski EL (2021). “patRoon: open source software platform for environmental mass spectrometry based non-target screening.” Journal of Cheminformatics, 13(1). doi:10.1186/s13321-020-00477-w .

Helmus R, van de Velde B, Brunner AM, ter Laak TL, van Wezel AP, Schymanski EL (2022). “patRoon 2.0: Improved non-target analysis workflows including automated transformation product screening.” Journal of Open Source Software, 7(71), 4029. doi:10.21105/joss.04029 .

Kapoulkine A (2022). “pugixml 1.13: Light-weight, simple and fast XML parser for C++ with XPath support.” Copyright (C) 2006-2018. http://pugixml.org.

Method new()

Creates an R6 MassSpecData class object. When headers are not given (i.e., NULL), a default ProjectHeaders S3 class object is generated with name as NA_character, path as get_wd() and date as Sys.time(). See ?ProjectHeaders for more information.

Usage

MassSpecData$new(
  files = NULL,
  runParallel = FALSE,
  headers = NULL,
  settings = NULL,
  analyses = NULL,
  groups = NULL,
  alignment = NULL
)

Arguments

files

A character vector with full file path/s of mzML or mzXML file/s or a data.frame with the columns file, replicate and blank with the full file path of mzML or mzXML file/s (character), the replicate group name (character) and the associated blank replicate group name (character). Note the file paths must have the extension .mzML or .mzXML.

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

headers

A named list with headers or a ProjectHeaders S3 class object. Each list element must have length one. There is no type restrictions except for name (must be type character length 1), author (must be type character length 1), path (must be type character length 1) and date (must be class POSIXct or class POSIXt length 1). See more information in ?ProjectHeaders.

settings

A named list of ProcessingSettings S3 class objects or a single ProcessingSettings S3 class object. The list names should match the call name of each ProcessingSettings object. Alternatively, a named list with call name, algorithm and parameters to be transformed and added as ProcessingSettings S3 class object.

analyses

A MassSpecAnalysis S3 class object or a list with MassSpecAnalysis S3 class objects as elements (see ?MassSpecAnalysis for more information).

groups

A data.table with feature groups from correspondence across MS analyses as obtained by the method get_groups(). Note that correspondence of features across MS analyses is performed with the method group_features().

alignment

A named list with a data.table for each analysis with the results from alignment of features or correspondence of features across analyses. The names of the list must match the names of the analyses.

Returns

A new MassSpecData class object.

Method print()

Prints a summary of the MassSpecData object in the console.

Usage

MassSpecData$print()

Returns

Console text.

Method get_headers()

Gets the headers.

Usage

MassSpecData$get_headers(value = NULL)

Arguments

value

A character vector with the name/s of the header elements. When NULL, the entire headers list is returned.

Returns

The headers list or the header elements as defined by value.

Gets the object history.

Usage

MassSpecData$get_history()

Returns

The history list of processing steps applied.

Method get_analyses()

Gets analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$get_analyses(analyses = NULL)

Arguments

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

Returns

Method get_overview()

Gets the overview data.frame with all the analysis types, names, replicates, associated blank replicates, polarities and full file paths.

Usage

MassSpecData$get_overview()

Returns

A data.frame with columns type, analysis, replicate, blank polarity and file.

Arguments

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

levels

Integer value or vector of length one or two with the levels of MS data. Possible values are 1 and 2 for MS1 and MS2 data, respectively.

Returns

Method get_spectra()

Gets spectra from each analysis.

Usage

MassSpecData$get_spectra(
  analyses = NULL,
  levels = NULL,
  mass = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  drift = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  millisec = 5,
  id = NULL,
  allTraces = TRUE,
  isolationWindow = 1.3,
  minIntensityMS1 = 0,
  minIntensityMS2 = 0,
  runParallel = FALSE
)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

levels

Integer value or vector of length one or two with the levels of MS data. Possible values are 1 and 2 for MS1 and MS2 data, respectively.

mass

A vector with target neutral mass value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named min and max with minimum and maximum neutral mass values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, neutral mass (in Da) and retention time (in seconds) and/or drift time values (in milliseconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mass and rt and/or drift. Then, the deviations given in the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of neutral mass, retention time and drift time targets. In this case, the column names must be min, max, rtmin, rtmax, driftmin and driftmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are not used.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt and/or drift. Then, the deviations given in the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z, retention time and drift time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin, rtmax, driftmin and driftmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

drift

A vector with target drift time values (in milliseconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum drift time values (in milliseconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

millisec

Numeric of length one with the drift time deviation, in milliseconds.

id

Character with the same length as m/z and retention time targets to be used as identifier/s. When not given, the id is built as a combination of the m/z and retention time ranges or values.

allTraces

Logical, when TRUE all level 2 data is returned. When FALSE and level has 2, only the MS2 traces of MS1 targets are returned, using the isolationWindow to calculate the mass window.

isolationWindow

Numeric value with the isolation window (in Da) applied for ion isolation and fragmentation during acquisition of tandem data (i.e., MS2 data).

minIntensityMS1

Numeric value with the minimum intensity of level 1 data (i.e., MS1 data).

minIntensityMS2

Numeric value with the minimum intensity of level 2 data (i.e., MS2 data).

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

Returns

A data.table with spectra for each analyses and targets, when defined.

Method get_chromatograms()

Gets chromatograms from each analysis.

Usage

MassSpecData$get_chromatograms(
  analyses = NULL,
  index = NA_integer_,
  minIntensity = 0,
  runParallel = FALSE
)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

index

Integer value with the index.

minIntensity

Numeric value with the minimum intensity.

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

Returns

A data.table with chromatogram/s.

Method get_eic()

Gets extract ion chromatograms (EIC) from the analyses based on targets.

Usage

MassSpecData$get_eic(
  analyses = NULL,
  mass = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  drift = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  millisec = 5,
  id = NULL,
  runParallel = FALSE
)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

mass

A vector with target neutral mass value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named min and max with minimum and maximum neutral mass values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, neutral mass (in Da) and retention time (in seconds) and/or drift time values (in milliseconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mass and rt and/or drift. Then, the deviations given in the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of neutral mass, retention time and drift time targets. In this case, the column names must be min, max, rtmin, rtmax, driftmin and driftmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are not used.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt and/or drift. Then, the deviations given in the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z, retention time and drift time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin, rtmax, driftmin and driftmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

drift

A vector with target drift time values (in milliseconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum drift time values (in milliseconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

millisec

Numeric of length one with the drift time deviation, in milliseconds.

id

Character with the same length as m/z and retention time targets to be used as identifier/s. When not given, the id is built as a combination of the m/z and retention time ranges or values.

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

Returns

A data.table.

Method get_ms1()

Gets MS1 data from the analyses based on targets.

Usage

MassSpecData$get_ms1(
  analyses = NULL,
  mass = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  drift = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  millisec = 5,
  id = NULL,
  mzClust = 0.003,
  presence = 0.8,
  verbose = FALSE,
  minIntensity = 1000,
  runParallel = FALSE
)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

mass

A vector with target neutral mass value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named min and max with minimum and maximum neutral mass values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, neutral mass (in Da) and retention time (in seconds) and/or drift time values (in milliseconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mass and rt and/or drift. Then, the deviations given in the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of neutral mass, retention time and drift time targets. In this case, the column names must be min, max, rtmin, rtmax, driftmin and driftmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are not used.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt and/or drift. Then, the deviations given in the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z, retention time and drift time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin, rtmax, driftmin and driftmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

drift

A vector with target drift time values (in milliseconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum drift time values (in milliseconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

millisec

Numeric of length one with the drift time deviation, in milliseconds.

id

Character with the same length as m/z and retention time targets to be used as identifier/s. When not given, the id is built as a combination of the m/z and retention time ranges or values.

mzClust

Numeric value with the mass deviation threshold (in Da) to cluster mass traces. Highly dependent on the mass resolution of the MS data.

presence

Numeric of length one with the required presence ratio from 0 (i.e., doesn't need to be present in any spectra) to 1 (i.e., must be present in all spectra) for traces during clustering of spectra.

verbose

Logical with length one. Set TRUE to output diagnostic and result messages. When FALSE, some messages are omitted.

minIntensity

Numeric value with the minimum intensity.

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

Returns

A data.frame.

Method get_ms2()

Gets MS2 data from the analyses based on targets.

Usage

MassSpecData$get_ms2(
  analyses = NULL,
  mass = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  drift = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  millisec = 5,
  id = NULL,
  isolationWindow = 1.3,
  mzClust = 0.005,
  presence = 0.8,
  verbose = FALSE,
  minIntensity = 0,
  runParallel = FALSE
)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

mass

A vector with target neutral mass value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named min and max with minimum and maximum neutral mass values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, neutral mass (in Da) and retention time (in seconds) and/or drift time values (in milliseconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mass and rt and/or drift. Then, the deviations given in the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of neutral mass, retention time and drift time targets. In this case, the column names must be min, max, rtmin, rtmax, driftmin and driftmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are not used.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt and/or drift. Then, the deviations given in the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z, retention time and drift time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin, rtmax, driftmin and driftmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

drift

A vector with target drift time values (in milliseconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum drift time values (in milliseconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

millisec

Numeric of length one with the drift time deviation, in milliseconds.

id

Character with the same length as m/z and retention time targets to be used as identifier/s. When not given, the id is built as a combination of the m/z and retention time ranges or values.

isolationWindow

Numeric value with the isolation window (in Da) applied for ion isolation and fragmentation during acquisition of tandem data (i.e., MS2 data).

mzClust

Numeric value with the mass deviation threshold (in Da) to cluster mass traces. Highly dependent on the mass resolution of the MS data.

presence

Numeric of length one with the required presence ratio from 0 (i.e., doesn't need to be present in any spectra) to 1 (i.e., must be present in all spectra) for traces during clustering of spectra.

verbose

Logical with length one. Set TRUE to output diagnostic and result messages. When FALSE, some messages are omitted.

minIntensity

Numeric value with the minimum intensity.

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

Returns

A data.frame.

Method get_settings()

Gets processing settings.

Usage

MassSpecData$get_settings(call = NULL)

Arguments

call

A string or a vector of strings with the name/s of the processing method/s.

Returns

A list with ProcessingSettings S3 class object/s.

Method get_settings_names()

Gets the names of all present processing settings.

Usage

MassSpecData$get_settings_names()

Returns

A character vector with the name of with the ProcessingSettings.

Method get_features()

Gets features from analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$get_features(
  analyses = NULL,
  features = NULL,
  mass = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  drift = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  millisec = 5,
  filtered = FALSE
)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

features

A character vector with the feature id/s or a data.frame or data.table with a column named feature with the feature id/s. A column named analysis can be given to specify from which analyses the features are returned.

mass

A vector with target neutral mass value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named min and max with minimum and maximum neutral mass values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, neutral mass (in Da) and retention time (in seconds) and/or drift time values (in milliseconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mass and rt and/or drift. Then, the deviations given in the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of neutral mass, retention time and drift time targets. In this case, the column names must be min, max, rtmin, rtmax, driftmin and driftmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are not used.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt and/or drift. Then, the deviations given in the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z, retention time and drift time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin, rtmax, driftmin and driftmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

drift

A vector with target drift time values (in milliseconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum drift time values (in milliseconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

millisec

Numeric of length one with the drift time deviation, in milliseconds.

filtered

Logical. When TRUE, filtered features/groups are considered.

Returns

A data.frame.

Method get_features_eic()

Gets EIC of features from analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$get_features_eic(
  analyses = NULL,
  features = NULL,
  mass = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  drift = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  millisec = 5,
  rtExpand = 120,
  mzExpand = NULL,
  filtered = FALSE,
  loaded = TRUE,
  runParallel = FALSE
)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

features

A character vector with the feature id/s or a data.frame or data.table with a column named feature with the feature id/s. A column named analysis can be given to specify from which analyses the features are returned.

mass

A vector with target neutral mass value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named min and max with minimum and maximum neutral mass values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, neutral mass (in Da) and retention time (in seconds) and/or drift time values (in milliseconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mass and rt and/or drift. Then, the deviations given in the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of neutral mass, retention time and drift time targets. In this case, the column names must be min, max, rtmin, rtmax, driftmin and driftmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are not used.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt and/or drift. Then, the deviations given in the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z, retention time and drift time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin, rtmax, driftmin and driftmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

drift

A vector with target drift time values (in milliseconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum drift time values (in milliseconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

millisec

Numeric of length one with the drift time deviation, in milliseconds.

rtExpand

Numeric value with the retention time values (in seconds) for expanding left and right the mass range.

mzExpand

Numeric value with the mass or mass-to-charge ratio (m/z) (in Da) for expanding left and right the mass range.

filtered

Logical. When TRUE, filtered features/groups are considered.

loaded

Logical. When TRUE and if available, previously loaded data will be used instead of extraction from raw data.

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

Returns

A data.table.

Method get_features_ms1()

Gets an averaged MS1 spectrum for features in the analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$get_features_ms1(
  analyses = NULL,
  features = NULL,
  mass = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  drift = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  millisec = 5,
  rtWindow = c(-2, 2),
  mzWindow = c(-5, 100),
  mzClust = 0.003,
  presence = 0.8,
  minIntensity = 1000,
  verbose = FALSE,
  filtered = FALSE,
  loadedMS1 = TRUE,
  runParallel = FALSE
)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

features

A character vector with the feature id/s or a data.frame or data.table with a column named feature with the feature id/s. A column named analysis can be given to specify from which analyses the features are returned.

mass

A vector with target neutral mass value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named min and max with minimum and maximum neutral mass values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, neutral mass (in Da) and retention time (in seconds) and/or drift time values (in milliseconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mass and rt and/or drift. Then, the deviations given in the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of neutral mass, retention time and drift time targets. In this case, the column names must be min, max, rtmin, rtmax, driftmin and driftmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are not used.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt and/or drift. Then, the deviations given in the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z, retention time and drift time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin, rtmax, driftmin and driftmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

drift

A vector with target drift time values (in milliseconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum drift time values (in milliseconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

millisec

Numeric of length one with the drift time deviation, in milliseconds.

rtWindow

Numeric vector of length two with the retention time values (in seconds) for expanding left and right the retention time range. The first element expands left and the second expands right. Note that the first element should be negative to expand to the left.

mzWindow

Numeric vector of length two with the mass or mass-to-charge ratio (m/z) values (in Da) for expanding left and right the mass range. The first element expands left and the second expands right. Note that the first element should be negative to expand to the left.

mzClust

Numeric value with the mass deviation threshold (in Da) to cluster mass traces. Highly dependent on the mass resolution of the MS data.

presence

Numeric of length one with the required presence ratio from 0 (i.e., doesn't need to be present in any spectra) to 1 (i.e., must be present in all spectra) for traces during clustering of spectra.

minIntensity

Numeric value with the minimum intensity.

verbose

Logical with length one. Set TRUE to output diagnostic and result messages. When FALSE, some messages are omitted.

filtered

Logical. When TRUE, filtered features/groups are considered.

loadedMS1

Logical. When TRUE and if available, previously loaded MS1 data is used instead of extraction from raw data.

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

Returns

A data.table.

Method get_groups()

Gets feature groups from the analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$get_groups(
  groups = NULL,
  mass = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  drift = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  millisec = 5,
  filtered = FALSE,
  onlyIntensities = FALSE,
  average = FALSE
)

Arguments

groups

A numeric/character vector with the number/id of feature groups.

mass

A vector with target neutral mass value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named min and max with minimum and maximum neutral mass values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, neutral mass (in Da) and retention time (in seconds) and/or drift time values (in milliseconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mass and rt and/or drift. Then, the deviations given in the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of neutral mass, retention time and drift time targets. In this case, the column names must be min, max, rtmin, rtmax, driftmin and driftmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are not used.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt and/or drift. Then, the deviations given in the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z, retention time and drift time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin, rtmax, driftmin and driftmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

drift

A vector with target drift time values (in milliseconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum drift time values (in milliseconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

millisec

Numeric of length one with the drift time deviation, in milliseconds.

filtered

Logical. When TRUE, filtered features/groups are considered.

onlyIntensities

Logical. When TRUE, only feature intensity values are returned. Feature metadata for each group is excluded.

average

Logical. When TRUE, feature intensities from each group are averaged and returned for each analysis replicate group.

Returns

A data.table.

Method get_groups_ms1()

Gets an averaged MS1 spectrum for feature groups in the analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$get_groups_ms1(
  groups = NULL,
  mass = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  drift = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  millisec = 5,
  rtWindow = c(-2, 2),
  mzWindow = c(-5, 90),
  mzClustFeatures = 0.003,
  presenceFeatures = 0.8,
  minIntensityFeatures = 1000,
  loadedFeaturesMS1 = TRUE,
  mzClustGroups = 0.003,
  presenceGroups = 0.8,
  minIntensityGroups = 1000,
  groupBy = "groups",
  verbose = FALSE,
  filtered = FALSE,
  loadedGroupsMS1 = TRUE,
  runParallel = FALSE
)

Arguments

groups

A numeric/character vector with the number/id of feature groups.

mass

A vector with target neutral mass value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named min and max with minimum and maximum neutral mass values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, neutral mass (in Da) and retention time (in seconds) and/or drift time values (in milliseconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mass and rt and/or drift. Then, the deviations given in the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of neutral mass, retention time and drift time targets. In this case, the column names must be min, max, rtmin, rtmax, driftmin and driftmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are not used.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt and/or drift. Then, the deviations given in the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z, retention time and drift time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin, rtmax, driftmin and driftmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

drift

A vector with target drift time values (in milliseconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum drift time values (in milliseconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

millisec

Numeric of length one with the drift time deviation, in milliseconds.

rtWindow

Numeric vector of length two with the retention time values (in seconds) for expanding left and right the retention time range. The first element expands left and the second expands right. Note that the first element should be negative to expand to the left.

mzWindow

Numeric vector of length two with the mass or mass-to-charge ratio (m/z) values (in Da) for expanding left and right the mass range. The first element expands left and the second expands right. Note that the first element should be negative to expand to the left.

mzClustFeatures

Numeric value with the mass deviation threshold (in Da) to cluster mass traces for features. Highly dependent on the mass resolution of the MS data.

presenceFeatures

Numeric of length one with the required presence ratio from 0 (i.e., doesn't need to be present in any spectra) to 1 (i.e., must be present in all spectra) for traces during clustering of spectra.

minIntensityFeatures

Numeric value with the minimum intensity for features.

loadedFeaturesMS1

Logical. When TRUE and if available, previously loaded features MS1 data is used instead of extraction from raw data.

mzClustGroups

Numeric value with the mass deviation threshold (in Da) to cluster mass traces for feature groups. Highly dependent on the mass resolution of the MS data.

presenceGroups

Numeric of length one with the required presence ratio from 0 (i.e., doesn't need to be present in any spectra) to 1 (i.e., must be present in all spectra) for traces during clustering of spectra.

minIntensityGroups

Numeric value with the minimum intensity for feature groups.

groupBy

String with the way of grouping. Possible values are groups and replicates to groups by feature groups or feature groups and replicates, respectively.

verbose

Logical with length one. Set TRUE to output diagnostic and result messages. When FALSE, some messages are omitted.

filtered

Logical. When TRUE, filtered features/groups are considered.

loadedGroupsMS1

Logical. When TRUE and if available, previously loaded feature groups MS1 data is used instead of extraction from raw data.

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

Returns

A data.table.

groupBy

filtered

Logical. When TRUE, filtered features/groups are considered.

loadedGroupsMS2

Logical. When TRUE and if available, previously loaded feature groups MS2 data is used instead of extraction from raw data.

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

Returns

A data.table.

Method get_groups_coverage()

Gets the percentage coverage of feature groups in the analyses (i.e. 100% means that a feature group is present in all the analyses).

Usage

MassSpecData$get_groups_coverage(
  groups = NULL,
  mass = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  drift = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  millisec = 5,
  filtered = FALSE,
  minIntensity = 0
)

Arguments

groups

A numeric/character vector with the number/id of feature groups.

mass

A vector with target neutral mass value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named min and max with minimum and maximum neutral mass values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, neutral mass (in Da) and retention time (in seconds) and/or drift time values (in milliseconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mass and rt and/or drift. Then, the deviations given in the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of neutral mass, retention time and drift time targets. In this case, the column names must be min, max, rtmin, rtmax, driftmin and driftmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are not used.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt and/or drift. Then, the deviations given in the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z, retention time and drift time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin, rtmax, driftmin and driftmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

drift

A vector with target drift time values (in milliseconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum drift time values (in milliseconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

millisec

Numeric of length one with the drift time deviation, in milliseconds.

filtered

Logical. When TRUE, filtered features/groups are considered.

minIntensity

Numeric value with the minimum intensity.

Returns

A data.table.

Method get_components()

Gets feature components (i.e., isotope clusters and adducts) in the analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$get_components(
  analyses = NULL,
  groups = NULL,
  features = NULL,
  components = NULL,
  mass = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  drift = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  millisec = 5,
  filtered = FALSE
)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

groups

A numeric/character vector with the number/id of feature groups.

features

A character vector with the feature id/s or a data.frame or data.table with a column named feature with the feature id/s. A column named analysis can be given to specify from which analyses the features are returned.

components

A numeric vector with the number/s of feature component/s.

mass

A vector with target neutral mass value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named min and max with minimum and maximum neutral mass values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, neutral mass (in Da) and retention time (in seconds) and/or drift time values (in milliseconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mass and rt and/or drift. Then, the deviations given in the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of neutral mass, retention time and drift time targets. In this case, the column names must be min, max, rtmin, rtmax, driftmin and driftmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are not used.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt and/or drift. Then, the deviations given in the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z, retention time and drift time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin, rtmax, driftmin and driftmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

drift

A vector with target drift time values (in milliseconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum drift time values (in milliseconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

millisec

Numeric of length one with the drift time deviation, in milliseconds.

filtered

Logical. When TRUE, filtered features/groups are considered.

Returns

A data.table.

Method get_suspects()

Gets suspects from features according to a defined database and mass (ppm) and time (sec) deviations.

Usage

MassSpecData$get_suspects(
  analyses = NULL,
  database = NULL,
  ppm = 4,
  sec = 10,
  filtered = FALSE,
  onGroups = TRUE
)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

database

A data.frame with at least the columns name and mass, indicating the name and neutral monoisotopic mass of the suspect targets.

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

filtered

Logical. When TRUE, filtered features/groups are considered.

onGroups

Logical of length one. When TRUE results are return based on feature groups not individual features.

Details

The ppm and sec which indicate the mass (im ppm) and time (in seconds) deviations applied during the screening.

Returns

A data.frame with the suspects and matched features.

X.

The list of modules data as defined by modules argument when NULL all data in modules is returned.

Method add_headers()

Adds headers. If an argument or element "name" is given, it must be type character. If an argument or element path is given, it must be type character and exist. If an argument or element date is given, it must be class POSIXct or POSIXt. If given date is character, conversion to class POSIXct or POSIXt is attempted. See ?ProjectHeaders for more information.

Usage

MassSpecData$add_headers(...)

Arguments

...

Arguments to be added as headers. Note that all given arguments must be of length one. There is no type limitations. The name of the argument becomes the name of the header entry. Alternatively, a single list argument with the headers (all length one) can be given.

Returns

Invisible.

Method add_settings()

Adds processing settings.

Usage

MassSpecData$add_settings(settings = NULL, replace = FALSE)

Arguments

settings

A named list of ProcessingSettings S3 class objects or a single ProcessingSettings S3 class object. The list names should match the call name of each ProcessingSettings object. Alternatively, a named list with call name, algorithm and parameters to be transformed and added as ProcessingSettings S3 class object.

replace

Logical. When TRUE, existing settings are replaced by the new settings with the same call name.

Returns

Invisible.

Returns

Invisible.

Method add_files()

Adds MassSpecAnalysis objects based on mzML/mzXML files. Note that when adding new mzML/mzXML files or MassSpecAnalysis are added any existing grouping of features is removed.

Usage

MassSpecData$add_files(files = NULL, runParallel = FALSE)

Arguments

files

A character vector with full file path/s of mzML or mzXML file/s or a data.frame with the columns file, replicate and blank with the full file path of mzML or mzXML file/s (character), the replicate group name (character) and the associated blank replicate group name (character). Note the file paths must have the extension .mzML or .mzXML.

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

Returns

Invisible.

Method load_groups_ms1()

Loads and average MS1 spectra from feature groups. If MS1 spectra from features are already loaded, the feature MS1 spectra are used for averaging into the respective feature group. If features MS1 spectra are not present, settings for loading and averaging features MS1 spectra (i.e., settings with call name "load_features_ms1") must be given in the settingsFeatures argument or added beforehand with the add_settings method.

Usage

MassSpecData$load_groups_ms1(settings = NULL, settingsFeatures = NULL)

Arguments

settings

A ProcessingSettings S3 class object with the call name applicable to the processing method. Alternatively, a named list with call, algorithm and parameters to be transformed and used as ProcessingSettings S3 class object. When not given, settings for the processing method will be searched within the MassSpecData object.

settingsFeatures

A ProcessingSettings S3 class object with the call name applicable to the processing method for features. Alternatively, a named list with call, algorithm and parameters to be transformed and used as ProcessingSettings S3 class object. When not given, settings for the features processing method will be searched within the MassSpecData object.

Returns

Invisible.

Method load_groups_ms2()

Loads and average MS2 spectra from feature groups. If MS2 spectra from features are already loaded, the feature MS2 spectra are used for averaging into the respective feature group. If features MS2 spectra are not present, settings for loading and averaging features MS2 spectra (i.e., settings with call name "load_features_ms2") must be given in the settingsFeatures argument or added beforehand with the add_settings method.

Usage

MassSpecData$load_groups_ms2(settings = NULL, settingsFeatures = NULL)

Arguments

settings

A ProcessingSettings S3 class object with the call name applicable to the processing method. Alternatively, a named list with call, algorithm and parameters to be transformed and used as ProcessingSettings S3 class object. When not given, settings for the processing method will be searched within the MassSpecData object.

settingsFeatures

A ProcessingSettings S3 class object with the call name applicable to the processing method for features. Alternatively, a named list with call, algorithm and parameters to be transformed and used as ProcessingSettings S3 class object. When not given, settings for the features processing method will be searched within the MassSpecData object.

Returns

Invisible.

Method subset_analyses()

Subsets a MassSpecData object on analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$subset_analyses(analyses = NULL)

Arguments

Method subset_features()

Subsets a MassSpecData object on features from analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$subset_features(features = NULL)

Arguments

features

A character vector with the feature id/s or a data.frame or data.table with a column named feature with the feature id/s. A column named analysis can be given to specify from which analyses the features are returned.

Returns

A new cloned MassSpecData object with only the features as defined by the features argument.

Method subset_groups()

Subsets a MassSpecData object on groups from correspondence of features across analyses. Note that when sub-setting groups, features that lose correspondence are not removed but filtered with "grouping" added as filter category/tag. Filtered features can be removed with the method remove_features(filtered = TRUE).

Usage

MassSpecData$subset_groups(groups = NULL)

Arguments

groups

A numeric/character vector with the number/id of feature groups.

Returns

A new cloned MassSpecData object with only the groups as defined by the groups argument.

Method plot_spectra()

Plots spectra for given MS analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$plot_spectra(
  analyses = NULL,
  levels = NULL,
  mass = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  drift = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  millisec = 5,
  id = NULL,
  allTraces = TRUE,
  isolationWindow = 1.3,
  minIntensityMS1 = 0,
  minIntensityMS2 = 0,
  runParallel = FALSE,
  legendNames = NULL,
  colorBy = "analyses",
  xVal = "rt",
  yVal = "mz"
)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

levels

Integer value or vector of length one or two with the levels of MS data. Possible values are 1 and 2 for MS1 and MS2 data, respectively.

mass

A vector with target neutral mass value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named min and max with minimum and maximum neutral mass values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, neutral mass (in Da) and retention time (in seconds) and/or drift time values (in milliseconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mass and rt and/or drift. Then, the deviations given in the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of neutral mass, retention time and drift time targets. In this case, the column names must be min, max, rtmin, rtmax, driftmin and driftmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are not used.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt and/or drift. Then, the deviations given in the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z, retention time and drift time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin, rtmax, driftmin and driftmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

drift

A vector with target drift time values (in milliseconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum drift time values (in milliseconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

millisec

Numeric of length one with the drift time deviation, in milliseconds.

id

Character with the same length as m/z and retention time targets to be used as identifier/s. When not given, the id is built as a combination of the m/z and retention time ranges or values.

allTraces

Logical, when TRUE all level 2 data is returned. When FALSE and level has 2, only the MS2 traces of MS1 targets are returned, using the isolationWindow to calculate the mass window.

isolationWindow

Numeric value with the isolation window (in Da) applied for ion isolation and fragmentation during acquisition of tandem data (i.e., MS2 data).

minIntensityMS1

Numeric value with the minimum intensity of level 1 data (i.e., MS1 data).

minIntensityMS2

Numeric value with the minimum intensity of level 2 data (i.e., MS2 data).

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

legendNames

A character vector with the same length as the targets.

colorBy

A string of length 1. One of analyses (the default), polarities, levels, targets or replicates.

xVal

Character length one. Possible values are "mz", "rt" or "drift".

yVal

Character length one. Possible values are "mz", "rt" or "drift".

Returns

A 3D interactive plot.

Method plot_chromatograms()

Plots chromatograms in the analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$plot_chromatograms(
  analyses = NULL,
  title = NULL,
  colorBy = "targets",
  legendNames = NULL,
  showLegend = TRUE,
  xlim = NULL,
  ylim = NULL,
  cex = 0.6,
  interactive = TRUE
)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

title

A string with the title.

colorBy

A string of length 1. One of analyses, targets (the default) or replicates.

legendNames

A character vector with the same length as the targets.

showLegend

Logical. Set to TRUE to show legend.

xlim

A length one or two numeric vector for setting the x limits (in seconds) of the plot.

ylim

A length one or two numeric vector for setting the m/z limits of the plot.

cex

A length one numeric value defining the scale of the legend for non interactive plotting.

interactive

Logical. When TRUE, the data is plotted interactively using plotly.

Returns

A plot.

Method plot_xic()

Plots extract ion chromatograms (EIC) and m/z vs retention time from the analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$plot_xic(
  analyses = NULL,
  mass = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  drift = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  millisec = 5,
  id = NULL,
  runParallel = FALSE,
  legendNames = NULL,
  plotTargetMark = TRUE,
  targetsMark = NULL,
  ppmMark = 5,
  secMark = 10,
  numberRows = 1
)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

mass

A vector with target neutral mass value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named min and max with minimum and maximum neutral mass values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, neutral mass (in Da) and retention time (in seconds) and/or drift time values (in milliseconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mass and rt and/or drift. Then, the deviations given in the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of neutral mass, retention time and drift time targets. In this case, the column names must be min, max, rtmin, rtmax, driftmin and driftmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are not used.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt and/or drift. Then, the deviations given in the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z, retention time and drift time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin, rtmax, driftmin and driftmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

drift

A vector with target drift time values (in milliseconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum drift time values (in milliseconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

millisec

Numeric of length one with the drift time deviation, in milliseconds.

id

Character with the same length as m/z and retention time targets to be used as identifier/s. When not given, the id is built as a combination of the m/z and retention time ranges or values.

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

legendNames

A character vector with the same length as the targets.

plotTargetMark

Logical, set to TRUE to plot a target mark.

targetsMark

A data.frame with columns mz and rt, defining the m/z and retention time values of each target. Note that the number of rows should match with the number of targets.

ppmMark

A numeric vector of length one to define the mass deviation, in ppm, of the target mark. The default is 5 ppm.

secMark

A numeric vector of length one to define the time deviation, in seconds, of the target mark. The default is 10 ppm.

numberRows

An integer vector of length one to define the number of rows to grid the plots. Note that each target is always plotted in one row for all selected analyses.

Returns

An interactive plot.

Method plot_eic()

Plots extract ion chromatograms (EIC) from the analyses based on targets.

Usage

MassSpecData$plot_eic(
  analyses = NULL,
  mass = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  drift = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  millisec = 5,
  id = NULL,
  runParallel = FALSE,
  legendNames = NULL,
  title = NULL,
  colorBy = "targets",
  showLegend = TRUE,
  xlim = NULL,
  ylim = NULL,
  cex = 0.6,
  interactive = TRUE
)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

mass

A vector with target neutral mass value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named min and max with minimum and maximum neutral mass values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, neutral mass (in Da) and retention time (in seconds) and/or drift time values (in milliseconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mass and rt and/or drift. Then, the deviations given in the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of neutral mass, retention time and drift time targets. In this case, the column names must be min, max, rtmin, rtmax, driftmin and driftmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are not used.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt and/or drift. Then, the deviations given in the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z, retention time and drift time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin, rtmax, driftmin and driftmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

drift

A vector with target drift time values (in milliseconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum drift time values (in milliseconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

millisec

Numeric of length one with the drift time deviation, in milliseconds.

id

Character with the same length as m/z and retention time targets to be used as identifier/s. When not given, the id is built as a combination of the m/z and retention time ranges or values.

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

legendNames

A character vector with the same length as the targets.

title

A string with the title.

colorBy

A string of length 1. One of analyses, targets (the default) or replicates.

showLegend

Logical. Set to TRUE to show legend.

xlim

A length one or two numeric vector for setting the x limits (in seconds) of the plot.

ylim

A length one or two numeric vector for setting the m/z limits of the plot.

cex

A length one numeric value defining the scale of the legend for non interactive plotting.

interactive

Logical. When TRUE, the data is plotted interactively using plotly.

Returns

A plot.

Method plot_tic()

Plots the total ion chromatogram (TIC) of the analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$plot_tic(
  analyses = NULL,
  levels = c(1, 2),

  legendNames = NULL,

  xlim = NULL,
  ylim = NULL,
  cex = 0.6,
  interactive = TRUE
)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

levels

Integer value or vector of length one or two with the levels of MS data. Possible values are 1 and 2 for MS1 and MS2 data, respectively.

title

A string with the title.

colorBy

A string of length 1. One of analyses, targets (the default) or replicates.

legendNames

A character vector with the same length as the targets.

showLegend

Logical. Set to TRUE to show legend.

xlim

A length one or two numeric vector for setting the x limits (in seconds) of the plot.

ylim

A length one or two numeric vector for setting the m/z limits of the plot.

cex

A length one numeric value defining the scale of the legend for non interactive plotting.

interactive

Logical. When TRUE, the data is plotted interactively using plotly.

Returns

A plot.

Method plot_ms2()

Plots MS2 spectra from the analyses based on targets.

Usage

MassSpecData$plot_ms2(
  analyses = NULL,
  mass = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  drift = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  millisec = 5,
  id = NULL,
  isolationWindow = 1.3,
  mzClust = 0.005,
  presence = 0.8,
  verbose = FALSE,
  minIntensity = 0,
  runParallel = FALSE,
  legendNames = NULL,
  title = NULL,
  colorBy = "targets",
  interactive = TRUE
)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

mass

A vector with target neutral mass value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named min and max with minimum and maximum neutral mass values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, neutral mass (in Da) and retention time (in seconds) and/or drift time values (in milliseconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mass and rt and/or drift. Then, the deviations given in the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of neutral mass, retention time and drift time targets. In this case, the column names must be min, max, rtmin, rtmax, driftmin and driftmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are not used.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt and/or drift. Then, the deviations given in the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z, retention time and drift time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin, rtmax, driftmin and driftmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

drift

A vector with target drift time values (in milliseconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum drift time values (in milliseconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

millisec

Numeric of length one with the drift time deviation, in milliseconds.

id

Character with the same length as m/z and retention time targets to be used as identifier/s. When not given, the id is built as a combination of the m/z and retention time ranges or values.

isolationWindow

Numeric value with the isolation window (in Da) applied for ion isolation and fragmentation during acquisition of tandem data (i.e., MS2 data).

mzClust

Numeric value with the mass deviation threshold (in Da) to cluster mass traces. Highly dependent on the mass resolution of the MS data.

presence

Numeric of length one with the required presence ratio from 0 (i.e., doesn't need to be present in any spectra) to 1 (i.e., must be present in all spectra) for traces during clustering of spectra.

verbose

Logical with length one. Set TRUE to output diagnostic and result messages. When FALSE, some messages are omitted.

minIntensity

Numeric value with the minimum intensity.

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

legendNames

A character vector with the same length as the targets.

title

A string with the title.

colorBy

A string of length 1. One of analyses, targets (the default) or replicates.

interactive

Logical. When TRUE, the data is plotted interactively using plotly.

Returns

A plot.

Method plot_features()

Plots features from analyses.

Usage

MassSpecData$plot_features(
  analyses = NULL,
  features = NULL,
  mass = NULL,
  mz = NULL,
  rt = NULL,
  drift = NULL,
  ppm = 20,
  sec = 60,
  millisec = 5,
  rtExpand = 120,
  mzExpand = NULL,
  loaded = TRUE,
  filtered = FALSE,
  runParallel = FALSE,
  legendNames = NULL,
  title = NULL,
  colorBy = "targets",
  showLegend = TRUE,
  xlim = NULL,
  ylim = NULL,
  cex = 0.6,
  interactive = TRUE
)

Arguments

analyses

A numeric/character vector with the number/name of the analyses.

features

A character vector with the feature id/s or a data.frame or data.table with a column named feature with the feature id/s. A column named analysis can be given to specify from which analyses the features are returned.

mass

A vector with target neutral mass value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named min and max with minimum and maximum neutral mass values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, neutral mass (in Da) and retention time (in seconds) and/or drift time values (in milliseconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mass and rt and/or drift. Then, the deviations given in the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of neutral mass, retention time and drift time targets. In this case, the column names must be min, max, rtmin, rtmax, driftmin and driftmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are not used.

mz

A vector with target m/z value/s (in Da) or a two columns data.table or data.frame named mzmin and mzmax with minimum and maximum m/z values (in Da), respectively. Alternatively, m/z (in Da) and retention time values (in seconds) can be given as one data.table or data.frame with columns named mz and rt and/or drift. Then, the deviations given in the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are used to calculate the ranges. Also works with a data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum values of m/z, retention time and drift time targets. In this case, the column names must be mzmin, mzmax, rtmin, rtmax, driftmin and driftmax. Note that when mass/time ranges are given, the ppm, sec and millisec arguments are not used.

rt

A vector with target retention time values (in seconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum retention time values (in seconds).

drift

A vector with target drift time values (in milliseconds) or a two columns data.table or data.frame with minimum and maximum drift time values (in milliseconds).

ppm

Numeric of length one with the mass deviation, in ppm.

sec

Numeric of length one with the time deviation, in seconds.

millisec

Numeric of length one with the drift time deviation, in milliseconds.

rtExpand

Numeric value with the retention time values (in seconds) for expanding left and right the mass range.

mzExpand

Numeric value with the mass or mass-to-charge ratio (m/z) (in Da) for expanding left and right the mass range.

loaded

Logical. When TRUE and if available, previously loaded data will be used instead of extraction from raw data.

filtered

Logical. When TRUE, filtered features/groups are considered.

runParallel

Logical of length one. Set to TRUE for parallel processing. Note that parallel processing is not always faster due to overhead.

legendNames

A character vector with the same length as the targets.

title

A string with the title.

colorBy

A string of length 1. One of analyses, targets (the default) or replicates.

showLegend

Logical. Set to TRUE to show legend.

xlim

A length one or two numeric vector for setting the x limits (in seconds) of the plot.

ylim

A length one or two numeric vector for setting the m/z limits of the plot.

cex

A length one numeric value defining the scale of the legend for non interactive plotting.

interactive

Logical. When TRUE, the data is plotted interactively using plotly.

Returns

plot.
